const shaders = GL.Shaders.create ( { instagram : { frag : ` precision highp float ; varying vec2 uv ; uniform sampler2D tex ; // uniform float hue ; uniform float saturation ; uniform float brightness ; uniform float contrast ; uniform float hue ; uniform float gray ; uniform float sepia ; uniform float mixFactor ; const vec3 W = vec3 ( 0.2125 , 0.7154 , 0.0721 ) ; const mat3 rgb2yiq = mat3 ( 0.299 , 0.587 , 0.114 , 0.595716 , -0.274453 , -0.321263 , 0.211456 , -0.522591 , 0.311135 ) ; const mat3 yiq2rgb = mat3 ( 1.0 , 0.9563 , 0.6210 , 1.0 , -0.2721 , -0.6474 , 1.0 , -1.1070 , 1.7046 ) ; const vec3 SEPIA = vec3 ( 1.2 , 1.0 , 0.8 ) ; vec3 BrightnessContrastSaturation ( vec3 color , float brt , float con , float sat ) { vec3 black = vec3 ( 0. , 0. , 0 . ) ; vec3 middle = vec3 ( 0.5 , 0.5 , 0.5 ) ; float luminance = dot ( color , W ) ; vec3 gray = vec3 ( luminance , luminance , luminance ) ; vec3 brtColor = mix ( black , color , brt ) ; vec3 conColor = mix ( middle , brtColor , con ) ; vec3 satColor = mix ( gray , conColor , sat ) ; return satColor ; } vec3 multiplyBlender ( vec3 Color , vec3 filter ) { vec3 filter_result ; float luminance = dot ( filter , W ) ; ( luminance & lt ; 0.5 ) filter_result = 2 . * filter * Color ; else filter_result = Color ; return filter_result ; } vec3 ovelayBlender ( vec3 Color , vec3 filter ) { vec3 filter_result ; float luminance = dot ( filter , W ) ; ( luminance & lt ; 0.5 ) filter_result = 2 . * filter * Color ; else filter_result = 1 . - ( 1 . - ( 2 . * ( filter - 0.5 ) ) ) * ( 1 . - Color ) ; return filter_result ; } vec3 applyHue ( vec3 Color , float h ) { vec3 yColor = rgb2yiq * Color ; float originalHue = atan ( yColor.b , yColor.g ) ; float finalHue = originalHue + ( h ) ; float chroma = sqrt ( yColor.b * yColor.b+yColor.g * yColor.g ) ; vec3 yFinalColor = vec3 ( yColor.r , chroma * co ( finalHue ) , chroma * sin ( finalHue ) ) ; return vec3 ( yiq2rgb * yFinalColor ) ; } vec3 applyGray ( vec3 Color , float g ) { float gray = dot ( Color , vec3 ( 0.299 , 0.587 , 0.114 ) ) ; return mix ( Color , vec3 ( gray , gray , gray ) , g ) ; } vec3 applySepia ( vec3 Color , float ) { float gray = dot ( Color , vec3 ( 0.299 , 0.587 , 0.114 ) ) ; return mix ( Color , vec3 ( gray ) * SEPIA , ) ; } void main ( ) { vec2 st = uv.st ; vec3 irgb = texture2D ( tex , st ) .rgb ; vec3 filter = texture2D ( tex , st ) .rgb ; vec3 bcs_result = BrightnessContrastSaturation ( irgb , brightness , contrast , saturation ) ; vec3 hue_result = applyHue ( bcs_result , hue ) ; vec3 sepia_result = applySepia ( hue_result , sepia ) ; vec3 gray_result = applyGray ( sepia_result , gray ) ; vec3 after_filter = mix ( gray_result , multiplyBlender ( gray_result , filter ) , mixFactor ) ; gl_FragColor = vec4 ( after_filter , 1 . ) ; } ` } } ) ; var Instagram = GL.createComponent ( ( { brightness , saturation , contrast , hue , gray , sepia , mixFactor , child , ... rest } ) = & gt ; & lt ; GL.View { ... rest } shader= { shaders.instagram } uniforms= { { brightness , saturation , contrast , hue , gray , sepia , mixFactor } } & gt ; & lt ; GL.Uniform name= '' tex '' & gt ; { child } & lt ; /GL.Uniform & gt ; & lt ; /GL.View & gt ; , { displayName : `` Instagram '' } ) ; module.exports = photoScreen

Handling user currency input
I 'm currently looking elegant solution achieve currency input user . Goal input feel natural , i.e : If example type ' 1 ' cash value shall : ' 0.01 $ ' . If type another ' 1 ' value shall : ' 0.11 $ ' . On specific solution input handled custom input button like one window calculator . Currently handled like ( The solution waaaay complicated 'm finding simple one ) Component State : this.state = { cash : 0.00 , } ; this.cashInt = 0 ; //represents value decimal point this.cashFloat1 = 0 ; //represenst first decimal place this.cashFloat2 = 0 ; //represents second decimal place Custom input button : & lt ; Button title= { ' 1 ' } onPress= { ( ) = & gt ; { this.addNumber ( 1 ) ; } } / & gt ; addNumber function : addNumber = ( number ) = & gt ; { ( this.cashInt === 0 & amp ; & amp ; this.cashFloat1 === 0 & amp ; & amp ; this.cashFloat2 === 0 ) { this.cashFloat2 = number ; this.newCash = parseFloat ( ` $ { this.cashInt } . $ { this.cashFloat1 } $ { this.cashFloat2 } ` ) ; this.setState ( { cash : this.newCash } ) ; } else ( this.cashInt === 0 & amp ; & amp ; this.cashFloat1 === 0 & amp ; & amp ; this.cashFloat2 ! == 0 ) { this.cashFloat1 = this.cashFloat2 ; this.cashFloat2 = number ; this.newCash = parseFloat ( ` $ { this.cashInt } . $ { this.cashFloat1 } $ { this.cashFloat2 } ` ) ; this.setState ( { cash : this.newCash } ) ; } else ( this.cashInt === 0 & amp ; & amp ; this.cashFloat1 ! == 0 & amp ; & amp ; this.cashFloat2 ! == 0 ) { this.cashInt = this.cashFloat1 ; this.cashFloat1 = this.cashFloat2 ; this.cashFloat2 = number ; this.newCash = parseFloat ( ` $ { this.cashInt } . $ { this.cashFloat1 } $ { this.cashFloat2 } ` ) ; this.setState ( { cash : this.newCash } ) ; } else ( this.cashInt ! == 0 & amp ; & amp ; this.cashFloat1 ! == 0 & amp ; & amp ; this.cashFloat2 ! == 0 ) { this.cashInt = + ( this.cashInt.toString ( ) + this.cashFloat1.toString ( ) ) ; this.cashFloat1 = this.cashFloat2 ; this.cashFloat2 = number ; this.newCash = parseFloat ( ` $ { this.cashInt } . $ { this.cashFloat1 } $ { this.cashFloat2 } ` ) ; this.setState ( { cash : this.newCash } ) ; } } ; So basically ( could n't find way make work ) everytime new number entered number get place second decimal place , previous value get offset left float . A special case yet handled handled solution value '00 ' , two zero another order allow user faster input hundred . Is way achieve ? An answer would greatly appreciated ! Thanks alot advance

React Native array prop confuse
I two component , parent ( prop . MANYSPACE1 MANYSPACE2 render perfect , confuse first ManySpace second ManySpace component array content I solve problem thanks . hope I explained problem import React , { Component } 'react ' ; //and import let MANYSPACE ; let icerik ; let firsttext ; let firstinput ; let answer1 ; let answerlength1 ; let secondtext ; let secondinput ; class ManySpace extends Component { render ( ) { MANYSPACE = this.props.manyspace ; icerik = MANYSPACE [ 0 ] .icerik ; firsttext = MANYSPACE [ 0 ] .firsttext ; firstinput = MANYSPACE [ 0 ] .firstinput ; ( firstinput ) { answer1 = MANYSPACE [ 0 ] .firstinput.answer1 ; answerlength1 = answer1.length ; } secondtext = MANYSPACE [ 0 ] .secondtext ; secondinput = MANYSPACE [ 0 ] .secondinput ; ( secondinput ) { answer2 = MANYSPACE [ 0 ] .secondinput.answer2 ; answerlength2 = answer2.length ; } return ( ) } -- My component import React , { Component } 'react ' ; //and import const MANYSPACE1 = [ { icerik : 'lorem ipsum ' , firsttext : 'lorem ipsum ' , firstinput : { answer1 : 'lorem ipsum' } , secondtext : 'lorem ipsum' } ] ; const MANYSPACE2 = [ { icerik : 'lorem ipsum ' , firsttext : 'lorem ipsum ' , firstinput : { answer1 : 'lorem ipsum' } , secondtext : 'lorem ipsum ' , secondinput : { answer2 : 'lorem ipsum' } , thirdinput : { answer3 : 'lorem ipsum' } } ] ; class OtherComponent extends Component { & lt ; ManySpace manyspace= { MANYSPACE1 } / & gt ; & lt ; ManySpace manyspace= { MANYSPACE2 } / & gt ; }

how to use Object.entries inside return function - reactjs
object : day : { `` day '' : '' 0 '' , `` 1 '' : '' 01 '' , `` 2 '' : '' 02 '' , `` 3 '' : '' 03 '' , `` 4 '' : '' 04 '' , `` 5 '' : '' 05 '' , `` 6 '' : '' 06 '' , `` 7 '' : '' 07 '' , `` 8 '' : '' 08 '' , `` 9 '' : '' 09 '' , `` 10 '' : '' 10 '' , `` 11 '' : '' 11 '' , `` 12 '' : '' 12 '' , `` 13 '' : '' 13 '' , `` 14 '' : '' 14 '' , `` 15 '' : '' 15 '' , `` 16 '' : '' 16 '' , `` 17 '' : '' 17 '' , `` 18 '' : '' 18 '' , `` 19 '' : '' 19 '' , `` 20 '' : '' 20 '' , `` 21 '' : '' 21 '' , `` 22 '' : '' 22 '' , `` 23 '' : '' 23 '' , `` 24 '' : '' 24 '' , `` 25 '' : '' 25 '' , `` 26 '' : '' 26 '' , `` 27 '' : '' 27 '' , `` 28 '' : '' 28 '' , `` 29 '' : '' 29 '' , `` 30 '' : '' 30 '' , `` 31 '' : '' 31 '' , } n't return anything ( show empty picker ) : return ( & lt ; Picker style= { { width : '30 % ' } } & gt ; { Object.entries ( day ) .forEach ( ( [ label , value ] ) = & gt ; { return & lt ; Picker.Item label= { label } value= { value } / & gt ; } ) } & lt ; /Picker & gt ; )

Shaka player live stream doe not start play-out
In react-native-web application , running Tizen smart web app Samsung smart TVs , use ShakaPlayer 2.5.6c play DASH live stream . The issue sometimes stream start . The DRM license received , segment fetched , somehow player show frame . The player log error . Hours later issue disappears . Also , issue seem affect device . The live stream originate Halo package used client well ( ExoPlayer , AVplayer & amp ; Chromecast ShakaPlayer ) , without issue . We use titanium DRM license wrapping . Below detailed timeline happens failing stream . The app register player listener event abrstatuschanged , adaptation , buffering , drmsessionupdate , emsg , error , expirationupdated , largegap , loading , manifestparsed , onstatechange , onstateidle , streaming , unloading , variantchanged . Additionally , every 2.5 second playhead , current manifest & amp ; buffering info written . For segment fetch , response date header shown . We tried wide range configuration , including different value buffering parameter , defaultPresentationDelay jumpLargeGaps videoRobustness . All result . The timeline show segment fetched multiple time . It look like player retrying fetch segment , although none fail . At first look like DRM issue , player able decode video chunk . When play-out succeeds see extra 'expirationupdated : change expiration time EME session ' event right 'drmsessionupdate : CDM accepted license response ' event , could support theory . However , error thrown player . What could cause behavior ? StartImageRotate ( ) ) } const RotateData = rotateValue.interpolate ( { inputRange : [ 0 , 1 ] , outputRange : [ 0 , 360 ] } ) const AnimatedLinearGradient = Animated.createAnimatedComponent ( LinearGradient ) return ( & lt ; Rounded corner for Arc Progress in react-native-svg
I 've created Arc Progress based tutorial ( v. http : //www.youtube.com/watch ? v=UMvw20nRZls ) worked fine But , since experience using svg path , 'm struggling Arc trying get 's corner rounded Here Arc 's result far const { PI , co , sin } = Math ; const { width } = Dimensions.get ( 'window ' ) ; const size = width - 32 ; const strokeWidth = 20 ; const AnimatedPath = Animated.createAnimatedComponent ( Path ) ; const r = ( size - strokeWidth ) / 2 ; const cx = size / 2 ; const cy = size / 2 ; const A = PI + PI * 0.4 ; const startAngle = PI + PI * 0.2 ; const endAngle = 2 * PI - PI * 0.2 ; // A rx ry x-axis-rotation large-arc-flag sweep-flag x const x1 = cx - r * co ( startAngle ) ; const y1 = -r * sin ( startAngle ) + cy ; const x2 = cx - r * co ( endAngle ) ; const y2 = -r * sin ( endAngle ) + cy ; const = ` M $ { x1 } $ { y1 } A $ { r } $ { r } 0 1 0 $ { x2 } $ { y2 } ` ; & lt ; Path stroke= '' # FFF '' fill= '' none '' strokeDasharray= { ` $ { circumference } , $ { circumference } ` } { ... { , strokeWidth } } / & gt ; And expect corner like : p : 'm using expo app , , needed install react-native-svg expo work

Best practice: use languageCode or LanguageTag with multi language app
So I followed tutorial creating multi language React-Native app . My app find language device match translation app . However tutorial ( coding wel ) us languageTag matching translation . A German phone would de-DE , English phone en-US etc . As I understand first language device , second region . So translation setup followed ; I18n.translations = { default : en , 'en-US ' : en , 'nl-NL ' : nl , 'fr-FR ' : fr , 'de-DE ' : de } ; However German phone US would languageTag de-US , would match de-DE : de part even thought phone set use German language , US translate German language . What prefer ? I thinking using LanguageCode check language . If languageCode 'de ' use German translation . Would reason using LanguageCode stead LanguageTag ?

outSR=102100 & amp ; resultType=standard & amp ; cacheHint=true ' ) ; // Current United States Totals let currentUnitedStatesCasesTotal = 0 ; // Current United States Increases let currentUnitedStatesCasesIncrease = 0 ; // Current Dates let currentCasesDate = null ; // Assign Cases currentUnitedStatesCasesTotal = response.data.features [ response.data.features.length - 1 ] .attributes.value ; // Assign Cases Increase currentUnitedStatesCasesIncrease = response.data.features [ response.data.features.length - 1 ] .attributes.value - response.data.features [ response.data.features.length - 2 ] .attributes.value ; // Assign Date currentCasesDate = new Date ( response.data.features [ response.data.features.length - 1 ] .attributes.dt ) ; // Set United States Cases Totals setUnitedStatesCasesTotal ( currentUnitedStatesCasesTotal ) ; // Set United States Increases setUnitedStatesCasesIncrease ( currentUnitedStatesCasesIncrease ) ; // All Cases Data + Dates let allCasesData = [ ] ; let allCasesDates = [ ] ; // All Cases Projected Data + Dates let allCasesProjectedData = [ ] ; // All New Cases Data + Dates let allNewCasesData = [ ] ; let allNewCasesDates = [ ] ; // All New Cases Projected Data + Dates let allNewCasesProjectedData = [ ] ; // Iterate Over API Data ( let = 0 ; & lt ; response.data.features.length ; i++ ) { // Check If Data Exists ( response.data.features.length & gt ; = 1 ) { // Add To Cases Data allCasesData.push ( response.data.features [ ] .attributes.value ) ; // Add To Cases Projected Data allCasesProjectedData.push ( null ) ; // Finish 1 Before The Last Item Due To + 1 ( & lt ; response.data.features.length - 1 ) { // Add To New Cases Data allNewCasesData.push ( response.data.features [ + 1 ] .attributes.value - response.data.features [ ] .attributes.value ) ; // Add To New Cases Projected Data allNewCasesProjectedData.push ( null ) ; } // Date Options let dateOptions = { day : 'numeric ' , month : 'numeric ' , timeZone : 'UTC ' , } ; // Formatted Date let formattedDate = new Date ( response.data.features [ ] .attributes.dt ) .toLocaleDateString ( 'en-US ' , dateOptions ) ; // Add To Cases Dates allCasesDates.push ( formattedDate ) ; // Add To New Cases Dates allNewCasesDates.push ( formattedDate ) ; } } // Set United States Cases + Dates setUnitedStatesCasesData ( allCasesData ) ; // See Below For Dates // Set United States New Cases + Dates setUnitedStatesNewCasesData ( allNewCasesData ) ; // See Below For Dates // CASES PROJECTIONS // Cases Last Date let casesLastDate = new Date ( currentCasesDate ) ; // Cases Projected First Date ( Add 1 Day To Last Date ) let casesProjectedFirstDate = casesLastDate.setDate ( casesLastDate.getDate ( ) + 1 ) ; // Current Cases const currentCases = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 1 ] ; // Past Cases const cases2DaysAgo = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 2 ] ; const cases3DaysAgo = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 3 ] ; const cases4DaysAgo = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 4 ] ; const cases5DaysAgo = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 5 ] ; const cases6DaysAgo = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 6 ] ; const cases7DaysAgo = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 7 ] ; const cases8DaysAgo = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 8 ] ; const cases9DaysAgo = allCasesData [ allCasesData.length - 9 ] ; // Day Changes const casesChange3To2 = ( cases2DaysAgo - cases3DaysAgo ) ; const casesChange4To3 = ( cases3DaysAgo - cases4DaysAgo ) ; const casesChange5To4 = ( cases4DaysAgo - cases5DaysAgo ) ; const casesChange6To5 = ( cases5DaysAgo - cases6DaysAgo ) ; const casesChange7To6 = ( cases6DaysAgo - cases7DaysAgo ) ; const casesChange8To7 = ( cases7DaysAgo - cases8DaysAgo ) ; const casesChange9To8 = ( cases8DaysAgo - cases9DaysAgo ) ; // Daily Cases Change ( 7 Day Average ) const dailyCasesChange7DayAverage = ( casesChange3To2 + casesChange4To3 + casesChange5To4 + casesChange6To5 + casesChange7To6 + casesChange8To7 + casesChange9To8 ) / 7 ; // Generate Projected Cases & amp ; Dates For Next 7 Days let = 1 ; ( & lt ; = 7 ) { // Increase Date By 1 casesLastDate.setDate ( casesLastDate.getDate ( ) + ) ; // Formatted Date let formattedDate = removeZeros ( casesLastDate.toLocaleDateString ( ) ) .slice ( 0 , 5 ) ; // Add Date To All Dates allCasesDates.push ( formattedDate ) ; // Increase Daily Amount let increasedDailyAmount = dailyCasesChange7DayAverage * ; // Today 's Increase let todaysIncrease = ( currentCases + increasedDailyAmount ) .toFixed ( 0 ) ; // Convert To Number todaysIncrease = Number ( todaysIncrease ) ; // Add Cases To Total Projected allCasesProjectedData.push ( todaysIncrease ) ; // Increase += 1 ; // Reset Date casesLastDate = new Date ( casesProjectedFirstDate ) ; } // NEW CASES PROJECTIONS // New Cases Last Date let newCasesLastDate = new Date ( currentCasesDate ) ; // New Cases Projected First Date ( Add 1 Day To Last Date ) let newCasesProjectedFirstDate = newCasesLastDate.setDate ( newCasesLastDate.getDate ( ) + 1 ) ; // Current New Cases const currentNewCases = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 1 ] ; // Past New Cases const newCases2DaysAgo = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 2 ] ; const newCases3DaysAgo = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 3 ] ; const newCases4DaysAgo = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 4 ] ; const newCases5DaysAgo = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 5 ] ; const newCases6DaysAgo = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 6 ] ; const newCases7DaysAgo = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 7 ] ; const newCases8DaysAgo = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 8 ] ; const newCases9DaysAgo = allNewCasesData [ allNewCasesData.length - 9 ] ; // Day Changes const newCasesChange3To2 = ( newCases2DaysAgo - newCases3DaysAgo ) ; const newCasesChange4To3 = ( newCases3DaysAgo - newCases4DaysAgo ) ; const newCasesChange5To4 = ( newCases4DaysAgo - newCases5DaysAgo ) ; const newCasesChange6To5 = ( newCases5DaysAgo - newCases6DaysAgo ) ; const newCasesChange7To6 = ( newCases6DaysAgo - newCases7DaysAgo ) ; const newCasesChange8To7 = ( newCases7DaysAgo - newCases8DaysAgo ) ; const newCasesChange9To8 = ( newCases8DaysAgo - newCases9DaysAgo ) ; // Daily New Cases Change ( 7 Day Average ) const dailyNewCasesChange7DayAverage = ( newCasesChange3To2 + newCasesChange4To3 + newCasesChange5To4 + newCasesChange6To5 + newCasesChange7To6 + newCasesChange8To7 + newCasesChange9To8 ) / 7 ; // Generate Projected Cases & amp ; Dates For Next 7 Days let j = 1 ; ( j & lt ; = 7 ) { // Increase Date By 1 newCasesLastDate.setDate ( newCasesLastDate.getDate ( ) + j ) ; // Formatted Date let formattedDate = removeZeros ( newCasesLastDate.toLocaleDateString ( ) ) .slice ( 0 , 5 ) ; // Add Date To All Dates allNewCasesDates.push ( formattedDate ) ; // Increase Daily Amount let increasedDailyAmount = dailyNewCasesChange7DayAverage * j ; // Today 's Increase let todaysIncrease = ( currentNewCases + increasedDailyAmount ) .toFixed ( 0 ) ; // Convert To Number todaysIncrease = Number ( todaysIncrease ) ; // Add New Cases To Total Projected allNewCasesProjectedData.push ( todaysIncrease ) ; // Increase j j += 1 ; // Reset Date newCasesLastDate = new Date ( newCasesProjectedFirstDate ) ; } // Set United States Cases Dates setUnitedStatesCasesDates ( allCasesDates ) ; // Set United States Cases Projected setUnitedStatesCasesProjectedData ( allCasesProjectedData ) ; // Set United States New Cases Dates ( Remove First Element Due To Day To Day Increase/Decrease ) setUnitedStatesNewCasesDates ( allNewCasesDates.slice ( 1 ) ) ; // Set United States New Cases Projected setUnitedStatesNewCasesProjectedData ( allNewCasesProjectedData ) ; } catch ( error ) { console.log ( error ) ; } } ; // Get United States Cases ( Timeline ) getUnitedStatesCases ( ) ; } , [ ] ) ;

React countdown timer using new Date()
I tried coding countdown timer follows . Every second getTime ( ) function called . In function , I variable named finishhours variable named currentHours . Finishhours equal time countdown timer zero . CurrentHours equal current time . To make calculation easier I format variable hour . For example , 10:45:32 become 10 + 45/60 + 32/3600 = 10,76 . From I calculate remaining hour , minute second assign value variable : rHour , rMin rSec . These 3 variable used display remaining time screen . The problem I facing function getTime ( ) get called multiple time every second . And number time get called increase exponentially . For example , one second elapses function called 2 time , one second later function called 8 time , 32 time , . This code : import React , { useState } 'react ' ; import ' .. /Timer.css ' ; const startDate = new Date ( ) ; const Timer = ( { end } ) = & gt ; { const [ rHour , setRHour ] = useState ( 2 ) ; //countdown 2 hour . const [ rMin , setRMin ] = useState ( 0 ) ; & gt ; & lt ; div className= & quot ; number & quot ; & gt ; & lt ; span className = & quot ; num-span & quot ; & gt ; { ( & quot ; 0 & quot ; + rHour ) .slice ( -2 ) } & lt ; /span & gt ; & lt ; span className = & quot ; segment & quot ; & gt ; : & lt ; /span & gt ; & lt ; span className = & quot ; num-span & quot ; & gt ; { ( & quot ; 0 & quot ; + rMin ) .slice ( -2 ) } & lt ; /span & gt ; & lt ; span className = & quot ; segment & quot ; & gt ; : & lt ; /span & gt ; & lt ; span className = & quot ; num-span & quot ; & gt ; { ( & quot ; 0 & quot ; + rSec ) .slice ( -2 ) } & lt ; /span & gt ; & lt ; /div & gt ; & lt ; div class= & quot ; My goal & quot ; first line & quot ; component like : & lt ; month name day showed strip & gt ; If user tap left arrow ( ) , strip & quot ; go back & quot ; show week containing first day previous month . If user tap right arrow ( ) , strip & quot ; move & quot ; show week containing first day next month . Example : today 4 sept. shown week current one : 30 aug - 5 sept. selected date 4 sept. tap right arrow -- & gt ; shown week current one : 27 sept - 3 oct. selected date always 4 sept. tap left arrow -- & gt ; shown week current one : 26 jul - 1 aug. selected date always 4 sept . This exactly Google Calendar behaviour . On right button , user tap button , selected date become today . On & quot ; second line & quot ; calendar strip built . It scrollable , shown week start always Monday . When user tap day , day become selected ( pas became black gray ) , shown week n't change . The selected day always center , remain original position . It change color . Today 's day always red unless selected . In case go back previous case would turn black . When shown week change , app download new data ( one range ) . DATES_STYLE } , dateNumberStyle : { color : 'red ' , ... DATES_STYLE } , } ; } } } dateNameStyle= { { color : 'gray ' , ... DATES_STYLE } } dateNumberStyle= { { color : 'gray ' , ... How to get endOf day toISOString() in momentjs but the millisecond should be .000Z and not .999Z
Basically I date : const = moment ( ) console.log ( now.endOf ( 'day ' ) .toISOString ( ) ) // 2021-10-25T21:59:59.999Z I would like : 2021-10-25T21:59:59.000Z As walkaround I console.log ( ` $ { moment ( ) .endOf ( 'day ' ) .utc ( ) .format ( 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH : mm : s ' ) } .000Z ` ) got desired printout , MAYBE SOMEONE HAS elegant way ? Thanks people !


How to extract date and time from ISO into local date and time
I date time ISO & quot ; time & quot ; : & quot ; 2021-10-28T17:30:00.000Z & quot ; Below I right extract date time : var dateExtract = time.substring ( 0 , 10 ) ; var timeExtract = time.match ( /\d\d : \d\d/ ) ; But giving exact date time written ISO . What I want extract date time local date time . I n't know .


React native svg image base64 not loading
How I display base64 image using ? Using code display image : import { Image } & quot ; react-native-elements & quot ; ; import Svg , { Image SvgImage } & quot ; react-native-svg & quot ; ; const b64 = & quot ; data : image/gif ; base64 ,  & quot ; ; & lt ; Svg height= { 220 } width= { 220 } & gt ; & lt ; SvgImage href= { { uri : b64 } } height= { 220 } width= { 220 } & gt ; & lt ; /SvgImage & gt ; & lt ; /Svg & gt ; & lt ; Image source= { { uri : b64 } } style= { { height : 220 , width : 220 } } & gt ; & lt ; /Image & gt ; . UPDATE : That 's I see DevTools . Should n't src instead ? UPDATE 2 : So look 's problem , iOS work . It known bug library : http : //github.com/react-native-svg/react-native-svg/issues/1587
